cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the capacity of wireless ad hoc networks, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The focus is on erasure networks, which are a type of network where packets may be lost due to interference or other factors, making it relevant to the networking and internet architecture subcategory (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the impact of random node locations on network capacity, which is a topic in stochastic processes and statistical inference (cs.SI). The use of erasure channels and broadcast constraints suggests a connection to coding theory and error-correcting codes (cs.DS). Finally, the paper uses mathematical analysis and asymptotic results, which are techniques commonly used in mathematical optimization and algorithms (cs.MA).
